intro: Trematolobelia rockii var. hawaiiensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian rock lily, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland habitats. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment and is considered a symbol of Hawaiian cultural heritage. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is also listed as endangered.
